editorialNotes.standard: If you can imagine it, you can create it—anything from monolithic towers to cavernous rollercoasters. That’s the idea that sparked a world-building phenomenon in Mojang’s amazing Minecraft. Since the game's release on the App Store, a steady stream of meaningful updates has kept this cube-filled universe fun, fresh and jam-packed with exciting features.

An intriguing genre blend, Terraria mixes collection, construction, and combat in a retro-styled 2D adventure. Break apart the world, uncovering rare treasures and digging deep underground for resources to build elaborate houses. Then craft powerful weapons and armor before facing bizarre, fantastical creatures. It’s a huge, sophisticated experience that’s easy to spend hours with—a universe of densely layered surprises, where every session is exciting.

advisories: Frequent/Intense Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: A hugely ambitious action blockbuster, Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas is filled with sharp satire, fascinatingly flawed characters, and a huge variety of ways to play. Explore the cities and countryside of a vividly realized fictional version of the southwestern United States. You can tackle story-driven quests, gorge on fast food, outrun the police, or obey every traffic light—it’s up to you. This enormous game deftly displays Rockstar’s unique mastery of open-world design, and it never fails to entertain.

Years after its debut, The Room remains one of the most absorbing puzzlers we’ve played. Use ingenuity and intuitive controls to manipulate a series of nested boxes and unlock the secret inside. As each thrown switch and decrypted code reveals another intricate enigma, breathtaking sights and eerie sounds weave an irresistible atmosphere of suspense. All the more amazing for being the debut effort from Fireproof Games, The Room beautifully blurs the line between entertainment and artistry.
Solve puzzles, inspect chilling notes and videos, and outrun a nightmarish smiling cat in the third chapter of this freaky horror series.

When dinosaurs collide with LEGO bricks, you don’t have to be Mr. DNA to know the result is pure fun. Starring characters and creatures from all four Jurassic Park movies, this fantastic adventure lets you relive your favorite moments from the series and even create new ones with your own custom dinos. Full of all the humor, action, and surprises you expect, it’s a wacky team-up of T-Rex proportions.

editorialNotes.tagline: Explore and survive a strange world
editorialNotes.standard: Just from reading the title, you know your objective. But as you explore amazing paper-cutout landscapes, you’ll uncover a weird world dense with secrets and danger. Slick controls make traveling and harvesting food simple, but balancing your hunger and health—and sanity—requires crafting weapons, traps, machines, and more. With tons of mysteries to uncover and challenges to complete, Don’t Starve will keep you enthralled.

Mesmerizing from start to finish, Monument Valley offers a world of uncanny beauty and constant wonder. To help a princess proceed on her mysterious quest, you’ll face ingenious puzzles that involve lifting and spinning the environment in seemingly impossible ways. It’s a mind-bending journey filled with the joy of discovery, making Ustwo’s adventure a must-play for gamers of every experience level.

editorialNotes.tagline: Clean up Gotham one brick at a time
editorialNotes.standard: Warner Bros. continues its tradition of App Store excellence with this clever bite-sized brawler, which mashes up the family-friendly LEGO brand with a classic comic-style good vs. evil story. Whether you take up Batman's cape and cowl or step into the shoes of a number of other Justice League heroes, saving Gotham City is a charming adventure for gamers of all ages.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Something happened to your fellow children—and the only way to learn their fates is by sneaking past menacing shadows in this chilling 2D platformer.

editorialNotes.tagline: Jump in and save the ninjas!
editorialNotes.standard: Goofy banter, diverting puzzles, wall-to-wall action—we couldn’t ask for more from a LEGO Ninjago game. Using the warriors’ trademark weapons and elemental moves, you’ll battle the nefarious Ronin and his crew across Chen’s Island, the Toxic Bogs, and other familiar settings. Even if you’ve never seen the Masters of Spinjitzu animated series, these hilarious heroes and their kid-friendly shenanigans are guaranteed to win you over.

advisories: Frequent/Intense Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Enigmatic settings and storytelling enrich the mysteries of Leonardo da Vinci's gadgetry in this escape room puzzle series’ fantastic conclusion.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: A terrific follow-up to our 2012 iPad Game of the Year, The Room Two continues the dark, foreboding tale introduced in its predecessor. Marvelously detailed graphics and eerie music make this first-person puzzler feel stunningly real, and as you travel from an ancient crypt to a séance room and beyond, you’ll love unlocking the secrets of every object—and learning more about your mysterious imprisonment.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Reimagining the decades-old blockbuster of the same name, Castle of Illusion Starring Mickey Mouse revamps Disney's love letter to classic platformers with a fantastic new design. Whether you have fond memories of the original or this is your first romp through the manic lands of the evil witch Mizrabel, Castle of Illusion epitomizes fantastic platforming. It’s an outstanding return for Disney’s most beloved mascot.

ios.subtitle: A story of beauty and illusion

editorialNotes.standard: We couldn’t wait to go back to the land of twisty towers and uncanny beauty—and this sequel didn’t let us down. With its striking colors and level design, it’s even more stunning than the first game. New elements like light beams and controlling two characters make the puzzles even trickier. The bond between that mother and child is what we’ll remember most, though—their relationship moved us in a way few games do.
editorialNotes.short: A powerful bond between mother and child drives this gorgeous, unforgettable game.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: The enchantingly eccentric Rusty Lake series heads underground! Solve strange puzzles in train stations representing different eras of a woman’s life.

editorialNotes.tagline: Team up to solve the puzzles

ios.subtitle: Feed Hungry Fish And Grow Big

editorialNotes.standard: Now here’s how you build a sequel! With The Room Three, Fireproof Games kept everything we love about this series—its chilling atmosphere, mind-bending puzzles, and beautiful visuals—while making masterful enhancements. It’s no wonder it’s an Honorable Mention for Best Mobile Game at this year’s Game Developers Conference. The story continues with trials set by a creepy new nemesis, The Craftsman. As you explore huge areas and tiny ones, the challenges feel increasingly epic, and a better-than-ever hint system ensures that finding solutions is super-rewarding.
editorialNotes.short: Brilliant puzzle designs and a haunting atmosphere make this unforgettable.

editorialNotes.standard: We loved returning to this bizarre world to fight, craft, and chuckle—and the sequel goes big with new features like handcrafted environments and dodge-rolls.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Put a little “boo” in your botany by concocting herbal remedies for odd supernatural ailments in this eerie puzzle-adventure.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References
Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Search for a missing dog through lavishly illustrated cityscapes in this relaxing adventure game.

editorialNotes.short: Unravel family secrets on a remote island cursed by plagues in this dark puzzle adventure.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: As ageless as its undead hero, Grim Fandango still feels as charming, funny, and original as it did back in 1998. It carries you on a wild adventure through the Land of the Dead, where your travel agent sells packages for a happy afterlife to newly departed souls—and uncovers a fiendish plot at work. Innovative art direction will wow first-time players, but with enhanced music and graphics plus hours of developer commentary, there are plenty of reasons to enjoy the game anew.
Talk about a sticky situation! Build structures with all sorts of goo to stretch this long-awaited physics puzzling sequel to new heights.

ios.subtitle: Train up and compete in races!

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Deliver packages to rebuild a ravaged society—and unravel supernatural mysteries—in this wild post-apocalyptic adventure crafted by legendary game maker Hideo Kojima.

ios.subtitle: A story about love and life

editorialNotes.standard: There is a subtle beauty to Florence. This poignant love story intertwines a succinct narrative with smart interaction design to create moments of surprising emotional weight. Conversations are turned into puzzles that evolve as the characters’ moods shift. Memories fade into focus like old Polaroid photos. The way you touch the screen becomes just as important as the plot, which makes for a story you want to steer as well as follow. Florence fosters a rare sense of intimacy with its characters, creating an impression that lingers long after the story ends.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Imagination becomes reality in 5th Cell’s spectacular puzzler—just write the name of almost anything in a magical notebook, and it appears before you. Expanding on the more linear Scribblenauts Remix, this game turns you loose to explore an open world. By creating everything from flying pigs to rocket launchers, you solve problems big and small for the people you meet. As the freedom to roam met the freedom to create, we got lost in coming up with the zaniest, most outlandish, or sometimes most diabolical ways to solve each scenario.

name: Tick Tock: A Tale for Two

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: The Gardens Between is pure magic. Two friends are transported to a cluster of surreal, spiraling islands populated with treasures from childhood memories. An elegant control system lets you manipulate time to help the pair navigate beautiful puzzles that evoke growth, loss, and friendship. A contemplative game that rewards observation and curiosity, The Gardens Between's inspired creativity is full of heart.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.tagline: You’ve got a mystery to solve
editorialNotes.standard: The magic of this culture-crossing adventure game lies in the great voice acting that empowers its wisecracks and genre in-jokes.

advisories: Frequent/Intense Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Donut County is an absolute treat. You drag holes across land to collect bigger and bigger aboveground objects, from puddles and fire pits to trees and boulders. New ideas change gameplay in intriguing ways, and concepts never overstay their welcome, making every puzzle feel new and interesting. The consequences of every hole you control propel a wonderfully quirky story about a suddenly subterranean society seeking a return to the surface. Along with the game’s fantastic visual style and marvelous soundtrack, its every idiosyncrasy miraculously blends into an inviting, cohesive whole.
editorialNotes.short: Geneva Hodgson: Story editor, Donut County

editorialNotes.standard: Not only is Knights of the Old Republic one of the best Star Wars games, but it's also regarded as one of the best role-playing games ever made. This version of BioWare's remarkable achievement features an interface adjusted for touch input. It lets you wield the Force and slash lightsabers across multiple worlds as you team up with brilliantly realized characters and follow an intriguing plot shaped by the choices you make.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Explore a gorgeous island packed with intricately interwoven puzzles. There’s a subtle logic to the world design that connects structures, land configurations, and puzzle grids. For persistent adventurers, The Witness is an unforgettable experience.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Three reasons you must play—or replay—LucasArts’ classic adventure: (1) The time-jumping story and quirky characters are as entertaining as ever. (2) So many clever puzzles and funny gags. (3) With beautifully updated graphics and sound, a slick new control scheme, and developer commentary, this remaster was clearly a labor of love.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Imagine WALL·E directed by Tim Burton—that’s the weird, wonderful world of Machinarium. But this cute robot’s quest for love combines tons more influences—like point-and-click adventures, hidden-object puzzlers, and comic books—for a truly unique experience. Challenging but full of awesome “aha!” moments, it’s an artistic odyssey that looks amazing on iPhone, iPad, or Apple TV.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Bursting with catchy tunes and googly-eyed foodstuffs, this embellished account of the PB&J sandwich’s creation is weird in all the right ways.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: After a jailbreak at an intergalactic prison, dangerous criminals are on the loose—and that’s great news for action fans. Pixelbite’s top-down tactical shooter flings your grizzled lawman and his crew into tense scenarios best tackled with a mix of stealthy flanking and brazen running-and-gunning. The controls are smooth, the graphics are gorgeous, weapon upgrades keep coming, and a fun story effortlessly propels you from one mission to the next.

The Dynamic Duo take to the stars in a brick-bashing adventure the whole family will love. As you travel from the Batcave to the Justice League Watchtower to deep space, hilarious banter and breezy puzzles make for classic LEGO®-game shenanigans. And with more than 100 playable characters—everyone from DC mainstays (The Flash, Wonder Woman, Sinestro) to delightful lesser-knowns (Etrigan, Plastic Man, Stargirl)—the fan service is unreal.

Explore imposing dungeons, battle savage monsters, and travel the high seas in this luscious top-down fantasy adventure from Cornfox & Bros. Featuring gorgeous art direction reminiscent of The Legend of Zelda: The Wind Waker, music by legendary videogame composers Nobuo Uematsu and Kenji Ito, and a wonderful world filled with secrets, Oceanhorn is an incredible journey.
editorialNotes.short: Explore uncharted seas in this beautiful, action-packed gem.

editorialNotes.standard: Tear apart the world to rebuild it in this creative post-apocalyptic survival game with an upgrade system that compels us to explore and experiment.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Come for the satisfaction of solving mysteries; stay for this unforgettable adventure’s lovable characters and excellent writing.
Find food for your cubs in treacherous environments as the last living mother fox in this emotionally charged adventure.

Badland is an eerie sidescroller in which you guide a nondescript creature through creepy and perilous environments. Thanks to simple controls and obvious objectives, the game is instantly accessible, but winding levels and unique power-ups make each stage an exercise in careful timing and hasty strategies. As the gameplay evolves and becomes increasingly bizarre, Badland remains incredibly fun.

The world’s most ridiculous goat is back in this hilarious massively multiplayer online game. From the very start, it’s obvious this isn’t your typical MMO. It all begins with you choosing one of six classes—which run the gamut from Magician to Microwave (seriously)—then embarking on bizarre quests. Like its predecessors, the game comes chock full of meta jokes, lovably preserved glitches, and destructible environments while boasting incredibly impressive landscapes and entertaining gameplay.
Build an astronomical number of potato-powered probes to investigate a mysterious planet in this compelling idle tapper.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Oddmar is overflowing with imaginative visual designs and creative challenges. One moment you might be gawking at beautifully rendered water, then grip your device white-knuckled as you’re whisked into an alternate realm of fast-moving spiked walls. With stunning artistry, humor, and a constant supply of surprises, Oddmar is a enchanting platformer. It introduces new ideas at just the right pace to maintain an exciting blend of the familiar and unexpected.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.tagline: Decide the fate of your kingdom
editorialNotes.standard: This game absolutely floored us. It seems straightforward at first—you’re a king, and you’re presented with choices about how to rule as a deck of cards. Swipe right to choose one path, swipe left for another. But there’s so very much more going on, and without spoiling anything, Reigns’ cleverness, humor, and sometimes agonizing choices routinely surprised and always delighted us.
editorialNotes.short: Decide the fate of your kingdom in this exceptionally clever adventure.

editorialNotes.tagline: Discover a memorable story full of humour
editorialNotes.standard: Double Fine’s riveting point-and-click adventure thrusts players into a timeless blend of whimsical sci-fi and dark fairy tale. Clever writing and stylish visuals keep its intersecting stories appealing—and at times, wickedly funny—with characters you’ll quickly become attached to (voiced by Elijah Wood, Jack Black, and other popular actors). Initially available with Act 1 only, Broken Age now includes the complete game—a one-of-a-kind odyssey that’s full of memorable moments.
editorialNotes.short: Discover a memorable story full of humor and charming characters.

editorialNotes.standard: A hopeful girl strives to cope with loss and overcome grief in the imaginative GRIS. This cinematic adventure’s gorgeous design, wonderfully fluid controls, and soothing soundtrack draw you into its memorable world—and keep you there. Face your fears and jump in.
